content:
Here are the top 10 soft and hard skills for a CCS (Customer Care Specialist) at Allstate:

Soft skills:

1. Communication skills: the ability to communicate effectively with customers and colleagues
2. Empathy: the ability to understand and relate to customers' needs and concerns
3. Active listening: the ability to listen to customers' concerns and respond appropriately
4. Patience: the ability to remain calm and patient, even in difficult situations
5. Adaptability: the ability to adjust to changes in processes and procedures
6. Problem-solving: the ability to identify and solve customer problems effectively
7. Time management: the ability to manage time effectively to ensure productivity and meeting targets
8. Teamwork: the ability to work effectively with colleagues and other departments
9. Attention to detail: the ability to pay close attention to detail and ensure accuracy in all tasks
10. Positive attitude: the ability to maintain a positive and professional attitude, even in challenging situations

Hard skills:

1. Knowledge of customer service principles and practices
2. Proficiency in using customer service software and tools, such as Salesforce and Workday
3. Familiarity with company policies, procedures, and products
4. Keyboarding and typing skills for efficient communication with customers
5. Technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
6. Data entry and database management skills
7. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel and Word
8. Ability to navigate the KB system and other internal resources effectively
9. Familiarity with Cronos or other timekeeping systems
10. Knowledge of DEIA (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Accessibility) principles and practices.
